snippet: Arizona’s law, which is to take effect Aug. 2, sets the earliest restriction on abortion of any of the eight other states that have similar laws.
abstract: Group of doctors and women's rights advocates challenge Arizona's new abortion limits in a federal lawsuit, claiming that they violate the Constitution and pose a threat to women’s health; law, set to take effect in August, prohibits abortions once 20 weeks have passed since a woman’s last menstrual period, weeks earlier than the threshold set by the Supreme Court.
lead_paragraph: Arizona’s law, which is to take effect Aug. 2, sets the earliest restriction on abortion of any of the eight other states that have similar laws.

headline.main: Lawsuit Tries to Block New Arizona Abortion Law
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Tries to Block New Arizona Abortion Law
